message.content:
We scan the transactions for the “Depreciation” entries. In this problem there are two such rows:
• The first “Depreciation” row (id “Depreciation20240101001”) shows an amount of 45,745.88.
• The second “Depreciation” row (id “Depreciation20240201002”) shows an amount of 60,147.44.

Since no accumulated depreciation exists in the opening‐balance (the “Fixed Assets” opening entry is simply the asset value and no prior depreciation was recorded), the “Accumulated Depreciation Initial Value” is 0.00.

At the end of the period the accumulated depreciation is obtained by summing the two depreciation amounts:
  45,745.88 + 60,147.44 = 105,893.32

Thus, the accumulated depreciation “item” in the balance sheet shows an initial value of 0.00 and a closing (end) value of 105,893.32.

Below is the answer in the required JSON format.

--------------------------------------------------

{"solution": {"Accumulated Depreciation Initial Value": "0.00", "Accumulated Depreciation End Value": "105893.32"}}
